trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a remote endpoint could not be found or reached.
The endpoint may not be found or reachable because the remote endpoint is down, the remote endpoint is unreachable, or because the remote network is unreachable.

This exception derives from <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException> that represents a class of recoverable errors that may be thrown during communication between endpoints and that robust client and service [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] applications are expected to handle.

To prevent a handler for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException> handler from catching the more specific <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException>, catch this exception prior to handling <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
Use this constructor when you want to pass an error message to the user.
The content of the message parameter should be understandable to the intended users.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException"></xref> class with data that specifies the source and destination of the stream and the information required to serialize the exception.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstruct the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that contains all the data required to serialize the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the source and destination of the stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException"></xref> class with a specified error message and the inner exception that caused the current exception.
Use this constructor when you want to pass an error message and information about an inner exception up to the user.
The content of the message parameter should be understandable to the intended users.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception can include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a `null` reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that caused the current exception to be thrown.
